title: Staffing Levels and Multi-Skilling
content: Adequate staffing ensures safety-critical tasks are reliably performed under normal and abnormal conditions. De-manning without workload reduction increases error risk. Multi-skilling provides flexibility but requires competence verification. Use staffing assessment methods like CRIOP to evaluate whether manning supports MAH control during emergencies.

scenario.story: Staffing is reduced from 3 to 2 personnel per shift in the engine room. Workload remains the same. During an emergency, can two people manage the response that previously required three?

options.B: Staffing reduction should have included emergency response assessment

scenario.explanation: Staffing changes require assessment of emergency response capability. Multi-skilling doesn't create additional people. If three were needed for emergencies, two may be inadequate regardless of normal operation competence.

openQuestions: Have staffing levels changed on your rig? How was safety impact assessed?
What safety-critical tasks rely on multi-skilled personnel? Are they competent in all roles?
